{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents suggest that facial nerve injury during forceps delivery is often due to the pressure exerted by the forceps on the facial nerve. This is not related to the absence of the mastoid process at birth or the developing stage of the parotid gland. There is no mention of a sublingual hematoma causing neuropraxia. Therefore, the most likely answer is that the beak of the forceps engages the main trunk of the facial nerve, causing the injury.", "answer_choice": "C"}
